Extract the Median Probability Model

Source: R/extract_models.R
extract_MPM.Rd

Extracts the Median Probability Model from a bas object

extract_MPM(object)

Arguments

object

An object of class "bas" or "basglm"

Value

a new object with of class "bas" or "basglm" with the Median Probability Model

Details

The Median Probability Model is the model where variables are included if the marginal posterior probabilty of the coefficient being zero is greater than 0.5. As this model may not have been sampled (and even if it has) it is oftern faster to refit the model using bas, rather than search the list of models to see where it was included.

See also

Other bas methods: BAS, bas.lm(), coef.bas(), confint.coef.bas(), confint.pred.bas(), diagnostics(), fitted.bas(), force.heredity.bas(), image.bas(), plot.confint.bas(), predict.basglm(), predict.bas(), summary.bas(), update.bas(), variable.names.pred.bas()

Examples

data(Hald, package=BAS)

#> Error in data(Hald, package = BAS): object 'BAS' not found
hald_bic =  bas.lm(Y ~ ., data=Hald, alpha=13, prior="BIC")
extract_MPM(hald_bic)

#> Error in extract_MPM(hald_bic): could not find function "extract_MPM"

data(Pima.tr, package="MASS")
Pima_bas = bas.glm(type ~ ., data=Pima.tr, n.models= 2^7, method="BAS",
           betaprior=CCH(a=1, b=nrow(Pima.tr)/2, s=0), family=binomial(),
           modelprior=uniform())
extract_MPM(Pima_bas)

#> Error in extract_MPM(Pima_bas): could not find function "extract_MPM"
